flood.description: Floods are an overflow of water that submerges land that is usually dry. They can be caused by heavy rainfall, storm surges, or the failure of dams.
updates: Flood warning issued for coastal areas.
Heavy rainfall expected in the northern region.
safety_tips: Avoid walking or driving through floodwaters.

earthquake.description: Earthquakes are sudden, rapid shaking of the ground caused by the breaking and shifting of subterranean rock as it releases strain.
updates: A 5.4 magnitude earthquake detected in the western region.
Aftershocks expected in the next 24 hours.
safety_tips: Drop, cover, and hold on during an earthquake.
Stay indoors until the shaking stops.

hurricane.description: Hurricanes are large, swirling storms that form over warm ocean waters. They can cause strong winds, heavy rainfall, and flooding.
updates: Category 3 hurricane approaching the eastern coast.
Evacuation orders issued for coastal residents.
